Episodes.Title: Nepotism
Episodes.Plot: Michael refuses to fire the new office assistant after everyone complains about his bad attitude. Andy plays it cool after Erin shows interest in another man. Meanwhile, Pam tries to impress Jim by pulling an office prank of her own.

Episodes.Title: Counseling
Episodes.Plot: Corporate assigns Michael to counseling with Toby. Dwight vows revenge on the Steamtown Mall after a shop owner snubs him. Meanwhile, Pam conspires to change her job title.

Episodes.Title: Andy's Play
Episodes.Plot: Andy invites the entire office to his community theater production of Sweeney Todd in hopes that Erin will attend. Michael tries to put his jealousy aside and enjoy the performance while Jim and Pam struggle with their incompetent babysitter.

Episodes.Title: Sex Ed
Episodes.Plot: Michael, believing he has herpes, contacts all his ex-girlfriends, including Jan and Holly. Andy tries to play on Erin?s compassionate side by holding a sex education meeting for the office.

Episodes.Title: The Sting
Episodes.Plot: When a competing sales associate steals a Dunder Mifflin client, Michael, Jim and Dwight decide to set up a sting to find out his sales secrets. Andy decides to start a band after finding out a friend from college has a successful music career.

Episodes.Title: Costume Contest
Episodes.Plot: When Darryl takes an idea to corporate over his head, Michael freaks out. Everyone in the office is in a competitive mood as the Halloween costume contest gets underway. Meanwhile, Pam tries to get the truth out of Danny about their dating history.

Episodes.Title: Christening
Episodes.Plot: Pam and Jim prepare for Cece's baptism. When Cece goes missing, Jim fears Angela has taken her.

Episodes.Title: Viewing Party
Episodes.Plot: An ostracized Michael does all he can to sabotage Gabe's party while Angela requests sex from Dwight.

Episodes.Title: WUPHF.com
Episodes.Plot: Michael tries to save Ryan's company by encouraging co-workers to invest. Meanwhile, Dwight has big plans for the office at Thanksgiving.

Episodes.Title: China
Episodes.Plot: After reading an article about China growing as a global power, Michael decides China must be stopped before they take over the US. Everyone in the office complains about Dwight's building standards and Pam threatens to move Dunder Mifflin to a new building.

Episodes.Title: Classy Christmas (1)
Episodes.Plot: Michael could not be happier when Toby has to take a leave of absence and corporate sends Holly Flax to cover for him. Pam is forced to do a second Christmas party after Michael wants the party to be on the day Holly returns to Scranton. Meanwhile, Jim regrets agreeing to a snowball fight with Dwight.

Episodes.Title: Classy Christmas (2)
Episodes.Plot: Michael could not be happier when Toby has to take a leave of absence and corporate sends Holly Flax to cover for him. Pam is forced to do a second Christmas party after Michael wants the party to be on the day Holly returns to Scranton. Meanwhile, Jim regrets agreeing to a snowball fight with Dwight

Episodes.Title: Ultimatum
Episodes.Plot: Michael prepares himself for the good or bad news about Holly and her boyfriend. In an effort to be an "awesome" office manager, Pam decides to put up a resolution board for everyone to post their New Year's resolutions.

Episodes.Title: The Seminar
Episodes.Plot: Holly and Michael turn Andy's business seminar into an improv challenge. Erin and Gabe compete in a board game battle.

Episodes.Title: The Search
Episodes.Plot: An emergency call from Helene forces Jim to abandon Michael at a gas station restroom, and Holly, Erin, and Dwight set out to rescue him. Gabe becomes offended at submissions to caption Pam's latest work of art.

Episodes.Title: PDA
Episodes.Plot: The staff grows increasingly uncomfortable with Michael and Holly's PDAs. Jim and Pam regret a champagne luncheon. Andy horns in on a romantic treasure hunt Gabe arranged for Erin.

Episodes.Title: Threat Level Midnight
Episodes.Plot: Michael screens his action film Threat Level Midnight to the office after eleven years of writing, shooting, re-shooting, and editing. The film features Michael as Agent Michael Scarn, Dwight as Scarn's sidekick, and Jim as archnemesis "Goldenface," as well as several people from Michael's past.

Episodes.Title: Todd Packer
Episodes.Plot: Traveling salesman Todd Packer comes to Dunder Mifflin looking for a desk job in the office. However, the office is unsure if they want him to work there due to his previous behavior. After dealing with computer problems, Andy confronts office administrator Pam to get a new computer.

Episodes.Title: Garage Sale
Episodes.Plot: The office holds a garage sale in the warehouse. Michael decides to propose to Holly, and runs into trouble thinking of how to do it well.

Episodes.Title: Training Day
Episodes.Plot: The new manager, Deangelo Vickers, has everyone hoping to make good first impressions: Andy finds himself awkwardly typecast while Jim and Pam worry that they've come on too strong. Only Dwight is apathetic about the new leader.

Episodes.Title: Michael's Last Dundies
Episodes.Plot: Michael trains Deangelo to take over his job of hosting the Dundie Awards, while Erin struggles with her dislike for her boyfriend, Gabe.

Episodes.Title: Goodbye, Michael
Episodes.Plot: Michael wants to have a drama-free day at work on his last day before moving to Colorado. Meanwhile, Deangelo Vickers and Andy Bernard scramble to retain Michael's biggest clients.

Episodes.Title: Inner Circle
Episodes.Plot: When Deangelo plays favorites, his management style is exposed.

Episodes.Title: Dwight K. Schrute, (Acting) Manager
Episodes.Plot: Dwight takes charge of the office and immediately imposes his will on the staff. Gabe hopes to get back together with Erin.

Episodes.Title: Search Committee (1)
Episodes.Plot: Deangelo's new replacement is sought out through a search committee process led by Jim.
Episodes.GuestStars: Ricky Gervais, Catherine Tate, Will Arnett, Ray Romano, James Spader, Jim Carrey, Warren Buffett, Kathy Bates

Episodes.Title: Search Committee (2)
Episodes.Plot: Deangelo's new replacement is sought out through a search committee process led by Jim.
Episodes.GuestStars: Ricky Gervais, Catherine Tate, Will Arnett, Ray Romano, James Spader, Jim Carrey, Warren Buffett, Kathy Bates

Episodes.Title: Goodbye Michael (Part 2)
Episodes.Plot: Michael wants a drama-free day to say goodbye to his friends; Deangelo and Andy work to keep Michael's most-important clients.
